alert.note: Alert for Dallas; Tarrant (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Tarrant and Dallas Counties through 1230 AM CST... At 1200 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Arlington, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Dallas, Arlington, Grand Prairie, Cedar Hill, Duncanville, and Cedar Hill State Park around 1205 AM CST. Irving and Cockrell Hill around 1210 AM CST. University Park and Highland Park around 1220 AM CST. Mesquite around 1225 AM CST. Other locations impacted by this storm include White Rock Lake, Joe Pool Lake, Mountain Creek Lake, Sand Branch, Buckingham, Dalworthington Gardens, and Lake Ray Hubbard. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35E between mile markers 411 and 437. Interstate 20 between mile markers 446 and 485. Interstate 30 between mile markers 25 and 64. Interstate 45 between mile markers 267 and 284. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
